intro: Conchophyllum angulatum, commonly known as the angular conchophyllum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom throughout the wet season, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
